oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.contentServer.publicApi
Interface ContentServer

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContentServerFsImpl, ContentServerWccImpl, ContentServerWcImpl
public interface ContentServer

Represents a data store for unstructured data. eg. images, word processing Contents, spreadsheets, etc.

Since:
11.1.1.7.3

Method Detail

closeConnection

void closeConnection()

Closes the connection being used for this repository.

Use the following pattern when interacting with the Content Repository to ensure thread safety and best performance:

ContentServer cs = null; try { ContentServerConnection conn = new [concrete connection class](...); cs = newContentRepository(conn); cs.doSomething(); } finally { if (cs != null){ cs.closeConnection(); } }

See the implementation classes for more specific examples.

See Also:
to construct ContentServer classes in a more generic manner.

getRenditions

java.util.List<Rendition> getRenditions(java.lang.Long revisionId)
Returns a list of renditions for the given revisionId.

Parameters:
revisionId - Uniquely identifies a Content in the Content Server.
Returns:
list of renditions

getExtraAttributes

java.util.List<ExtraAttribute> getExtraAttributes(java.lang.Long revisionId)
Returns a list of extra attributes for the given revisionId.

Parameters:
revisionId - Uniquely identifies a Content in the Content Server.
Returns:
list of extra attributes

setSignRequired

void setSignRequired(boolean signRequired)
Set this values to indicate whether the request to the Content Server needs to be signed. Setting this to true indicates that request to the Content Server will be trusted.

Parameters:
signRequired - true iff request to the content server are to be signed.

isSignRequired

boolean isSignRequired()
Indicates whether requests to the Content Server are to be trusted.

Returns:
true iff request to the content server are to be signed.

upload

Rendition upload(Rendition rendition,
                 java.io.InputStream input)
Uploads a rendition to the Content Server.

Parameters:
rendition - attributes that describe the rendition. For example, name.
input - The contents of the file being uploaded.
Returns:
the uploaded rendition. This will contain the attributes set by the Content Server.
Since:
11.1.1.7.4

delete

void delete(Rendition rendition)
Deletes a rendition from the Content Server.

Parameters:
rendition - attributes that describe the rendition. In particular, the primary key attributes of RevisionId and Name.
Since:
11.1.1.7.4

update

ExtraAttribute update(ExtraAttribute extraAttribute)
Updates the extra attribute.

Parameters:
extraAttribute - additional attribute that describes the content. The primary key values and connection are used to determine the row to be updated. Only the value value can be updatd.
Returns:
the updated extraAttribute.
Since:
11.1.1.7.4

getOptions

java.util.List<Option> getOptions(java.lang.String name)
Returns a list of values based on the list name.

Parameters:
name - identifies the list.
Returns:
list of values.
Since:
11.1.1.7.4
